thread.title: February 21, 6 pm headlines: Reliance Jio Prime membership announced, government launches free anti-virus, UK assures Mallya's extradition
thread.title_full: February 21, 6 pm headlines: Reliance Jio Prime membership announced, government launches free anti-virus, UK assures Mallya's extradition - The Financial Express

author: FE Online
title: February 21, 6 pm headlines: Reliance Jio Prime membership announced, government launches free anti-virus, UK assures Mallya's extradition
text:
Ambani kept the promise of providing cheap data services and free voice calls to people all across the country. Reliance Jio Prime membership
Reliance Industries Limited chairman Mukesh Ambani on Monday announced the Reliance Jio Prime membership plan for existing Reliance Jio customers. As per his earlier promise, Ambani has kept very cheap data services and free voice calls to people all across the country. Jio is offering Prime membership to its existing customers. So far all Jio services have been free to all. However, customers will have to pay for the Jio services from April 1. Prime membership will allow existing customers of Reliance Jio to avail cheap services for one more year.
Watch: 5 Simple Steps To Follow To Convert To Reliance Jio Prime
Government launches free anti-virus for PC, mobile phones
The IT Ministry today launched anti-malware analysis centre that will facilitate free anti-virus for computers and mobile phones in the country with project cost of Rs 90 crore spread over period of five years. “I would like ISPs (Internet Service Provider) to encourage their consumers to come on board, there is a free service available. Come and use it in the event some malware has sneaked in to the system,” IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said at the launch of Botnet Cleaning and Malware Analysis Centre. In new programme, Indian cyber security watchdog CertIn will collect data of infected systems and send it to ISPs and banks. A report said that these ISPs and banks will identify the user and provide them with link of the centre, launched in name of Cyber Swachhta Kendra. The users can download and install anti-virus or anti-malware tools from internet.
UK authorities assure Vijay Mallya’s extradition
In a big development, United Kingdom authorities on Tuesday assured Indian officials to extradite absconding businessman Vijay Mallya. On Monday, the Home Ministry forwarded to the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) a court-issued request to bring back embattled liquor baron Vijay Mallya from the United Kingdom to India to face money laundering probe. The MEA and Home Ministry are working in sync to bring Mallya back. Home Ministry has provided it details of the Mumbai special court order which approved the Enforcement Directorate’s request to invoke the India-UK Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) to bring back Mallya to the country.
